revised_title: Causes and Prevention of Miners' Nystagmus
tldr: Miners' nystagmus is an eye condition that affects coal miners, causing a rotatory oscillation of the eyeballs and impairing their vision. The main cause of this condition is believed to be the strain of working in poor lighting conditions and maintaining an awkward head position. The author suggests that improving lighting in mines and adopting safer working practices can help prevent this occupational neurosis.
